explanation: The report is correct. In OS_TimerGetInfo the local pointers timecb and timebase are only used for read access (timecb->timebase_token, timecb->interval_time, timebase->accuracy_usec) and are never used to modify the pointed objects. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13, such pointers should be declared to point to const-qualified types when possible (e.g. const OS_timecb_internal_record_t *timecb, const OS_timebase_internal_record_t *timebase). Assigning the non-const result of the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro to a const-qualified pointer is valid in C, so there is no technical obstacle preventing these pointers from being const. Therefore the current non-const declarations violate Rule 8.13 (unless a documented justification/suppression is in place).
